criteria: Accuracy in Performing Operations: Assesses the student's ability to correctly add, subtract, multiply, and divide rational numbers.
Application to Real-World Problems: Assesses the student's ability to apply operations with rational numbers to solve real-world mathematical problems.
Understanding of Complex Fractions: Assesses the student's ability to extend the rules for manipulating fractions to complex fractions.
descriptions: Student demonstrates no understanding of operations with rational numbers and makes significant errors in calculations.
Student demonstrates limited understanding of operations with rational numbers and makes frequent errors in calculations.
Student demonstrates some understanding of operations with rational numbers but still makes several errors in calculations.
Student demonstrates a general understanding of operations with rational numbers and makes occasional errors in calculations.
Student demonstrates a solid understanding of operations with rational numbers and makes few errors in calculations.
Student demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of operations with rational numbers and performs calculations accurately with no errors.
Student is unable to apply operations with rational numbers to solve real-world problems and demonstrates no understanding of problem-solving strategies.
Student attempts to apply operations with rational numbers to solve real-world problems but is unsuccessful and demonstrates limited understanding of problem-solving strategies.
Student is partially successful in applying operations with rational numbers to solve real-world problems but struggles with problem-solving strategies.
Student applies operations with rational numbers to solve real-world problems with some success but may require assistance with problem-solving strategies.
Student applies operations with rational numbers to solve real-world problems effectively and demonstrates a good understanding of problem-solving strategies.
Student applies operations with rational numbers to solve real-world problems proficiently and demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of problem-solving strategies.
Student demonstrates no understanding of complex fractions and is unable to manipulate them.
Student demonstrates limited understanding of complex fractions and struggles to manipulate them.
Student demonstrates some understanding of complex fractions but requires assistance to manipulate them.
Student manipulates complex fractions with some success but may make occasional errors.
Student manipulates complex fractions effectively with few errors.
Student manipulates complex fractions proficiently and accurately with no errors.
